original_title: Sri Lanka passport application online, fingerprints at 51 regional offices
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Department of Immigration and Emigration said it had launched an online passport application platform, allowing residents in provinces to avoid coming to the Colombo head office.
“The programme will allow passport applicants to apply online,” the Department said in a statement.
“Also applicants can send their fingerprints for the passport through Department for Registration of Persons sub offices, established in 51 secretariat offices island wide,”
The passports will be delivered to the applicant’s addresses upon completion within three days.
The one-day service of giving passports is also performed as usual, the statement said. (Colombo/ June 15/2023)
